info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 08 at 8:48PM MDT until July 08 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM MDT FOR NORTHERN BLAINE AND EAST CENTRAL HILL COUNTIES... At 847 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Beaver Creek to 13 miles south of Chinook to 21 miles southwest of Fort Belknap, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar and automated sensor indicated. At 845 PM, 60 mph wind was reported Chinook. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Havre, Chinook, Harlem, Beaver Creek, Fort Belknap, Turner, Lohman, Lloyd, Kremlin, Hogeland, Cleveland and Zurich. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
